TextView.android:text: 1)Two parallel plates are separated by a distance D charged by V volt. The field intensity E is given by
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 Electric field intensity between two points is always expressed as the potential difference 
 between these two points divided by the distance between them. The strength of electric 
 field or electric field intensity is measured by volt per meter or newton per meter.
2)The right hand rule for determining the direction of the induced EMF was introduced by
View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 The right hand rule for determining the direction of induced EMF was introduced by 
 Fleming and it is well known as Fleming’s right hand rule. It is used to find the direction 
 of induced emf of a generator.
3)Whenever the magnetic flux changes with respect to an electric conductor or a coil, an EMF is induced in the conductor is Faraday’s
View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 Faraday’s law of electromagnetic induction states 
 1.Whenever a changing flux links with a conductor, there will be an EMF induced in the conductor. 
 2.The magnitude of this induced EMF is directly proportional to the rate of change of flux linkage with respect to time.

 These two statements are well-known as Faraday’s first and 
 second law of electromagnetic induction respectively.
4)Which of the following represents ohms law
View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 These are the different forms to represent the ohms law. 
 1) Ohms law states that at constant temperature potential difference across the 
 element is directly proportional to current flowing through the element.

 2) Ohms law states that at constant temperature current density is directly 
 proportional to field intensity

 Ohms law is valid only when temperature and conductivity of the material is constant.
5)Conductor is static and the field is varying then emf will be induced. This principle is called
View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 According to the Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction principle, the emf will be 
 induced whenever conductor cuts a varying field or vice versa. The emf will be induced 
 when an alternating magnetic field cuts the rotor conductor.
6)As a result of reflection from a plane conducting wall, electromagnetic waves acquire an \n apparent velocity greater than the velocity of light in space. This is called the
View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 The phase velocity of a wave is the rate at which the phase of the wave propagates in 
 space. This is the speed at which the phase of any one frequency component of the wave 
 travels. Basically, the speed of this velocity is greater than the velocity of light in space.
7)Two infinite parallel metal plates are charged with equal surface charge density of the \n same polarity. The electric field in the gap between the plates is

RadioButton.android:text: A)same as that produced by one plate.
B)double the field produced by one plate.
C)dependent on coordinates of field points.

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option D \n The equal surface charge densities are having same charge either positive or negative. So, \n same charge repels each other. Hence, the resultant electric field in the gap between the plates is zero. .
8)Inside a hollow conducting sphere

RadioButton.android:text: B)electric field is a non zero constant.
C)electric field changes with magnitude of the charge given to the conductor.
D)electric field changes with distance from the center of the sphere.

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 For any conducting sphere, the charge enclosed is zero and hence, the electric field inside 
 it is zero. This is an application of the Gauss Law. In fact Gaussian surface includes no 
 charges inside it.
9) Electric field intensity (E) at ant point in an electric field is equal to
View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 The total electric field at any point is equal to the vector sum of the separate electric fields 
 that each point charge would create in the absence of the others. That is, 
 The electric field is nothing but the potential gradient of that particular point.
10)A conductor of length L has current I passing through it, when it is placed parallel to \n strong magnetic field. The force experienced by the conductor will be
View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 The force can be found with the given expression F = I × L × B × sinθ and θ is the angle 
 between I and B. When that current carrying conductor is placed parallel to the magnetic 
 field, then the angle between current and magnetic field is zero. So, sinθ = sin0° = 0. 
 Hence, the force experienced by the conductor is zero.
11)The force between two long parallel conductors is inversely proportional to

RadioButton.android:text: D)product of current in two conductors.

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option C \n If the current is flowing through the two different conductors ‘d’ distance apart, in the same direction, then the force between the two conductors is directly proportional to the product of the currents and inversely proportional to the distance between the two conductors.
12)In the left hand rule, forefinger always represents

RadioButton.android:text: D)direction of force on the conductor.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Thumb finger represents the direction of force, Fore finger represents the direction of magnetic field, middle finger represents the direction of current.
13) Cork Screw rule is used to find
View Answer

Answer : Option B \n The direction in which the head of the cork screw rotates that would give the direction of the magnetic field or magnetic force of lines. The shape of this magnetic field is circular and the direction of magnetic field is clock-wise.
14)Two long parallel conductors carry 100 A. If the conductors are separated by 20 mm, the force per meter of length of each conductor will be
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n Current I1 and I2 = 100 Amps, Distance = 20 mm = 20 × 10-3 m, Force = ? The force is found by the following expression
15)The field at any point on the axis of a current carrying coil will be

RadioButton.android:text: A)at angle of 45° with the axis.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option B \n
16)Two straight parallel conductors carry equal currents in opposite direction. The force between them is
View Answer

Answer : Option A \n When two current carrying conductors are placed parallelly, there will be a force acting between them. The force is attractive if direction of currents in the conductor is same and it is repulsive if the direction of the currents is opposite. This can easily be explained by right hand rule.
17)The change of cross sectional area of conductor in magnetic field will affect

RadioButton.android:text: C)(A) and (B) both in the same way.

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option C \n We know that the cross sectional area is inversely proportional to the resistance of the conductor. In magnetic circuits, reluctance is analogous to the resistance. Hence, the resistance and reluctance would be affected in the same way.
18)A point pole has a strength of 4π × 10-4 weber. The force in newtons on a point pole of 4π × 1.5 × 10-4 weber placed at a distance of 10 cm from it will be
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Given data: Pole strength m1 = 4π × 10-7 Weber m2 = 4π × 1.5 × 10-4; r = 10 cm. We know that the force is found by the below expression,
19) The drawback of Daltons atomic structure is that, it says

RadioButton.android:text: A) the atoms can neither be created nor be destroyed.
C)most of the volume of an atom is empty space.

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option A \n The Dalton’s atomic theory deals with chemical reactions. During chemical reactions, an atom can neither be created nor be destroyed. But, in radio active reaction, new atoms can be created by dividing other atoms. Thus, this is the very big drawback of this method.
20)According to Coulomb’s law, the force of attraction or repulsion, between to electrical charges is

RadioButton.android:text: A)directly proportional to the square of the distance between them.
B)inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.
C)inversely proportional to the distance between them.
D)directly proportional to the distance between them.

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option B \n Coulomb’s law states that the force of attraction or repulsion, F between two charges q1 and q2 coulombs, connected at two different points in a medium, is directly proportional to the product of their magnitude and inversely proportional to the square of distance r between them.
